name: Christopher Andrei Tayao
summary: A student of Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, major in Software Development. I have years of experience in using the Python, C#, and C programming languages as part of my hobby and as an open-source contributor. As a former part-time systems administrator at a computer café with 10-20 client machines each in three branches, I can manage and maintain a computer network with ease and efficiency. I am very enthusiastic when it comes to computers and security, and I learn new things very quickly.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
education.thesisTitle: BENTO (Baliuag Enhanced Network for Tracking Canteen Operations)

responsibilities: Completed commissioned design and video projects for a regional hospital client.
Created marketing materials including tarpaulins, event invitations, and posters.
Produced short-form video advertisements and social media reels for healthcare campaigns.
Delivered visually engaging content under tight deadlines while meeting client branding requirements.
Edited and retouched ID cards, event photos, invitations, and corporate materials using Adobe Photoshop.
Produced and edited videos for events, vlogs, tutorials, and marketing content using Adobe Premiere Pro.
Collaborated with clients to ensure brand consistency and visual appeal in final outputs.
Developed automation systems for ID card production, improving efficiency for schools and small businesses in Bulacan.
Maintained and secured local area networks across multiple café branches, supporting 10-20 client systems per location.
Monitored system performance and performed routine maintenance to ensure optimal uptime and user experience.
Installed, configured, and troubleshot Windows-based systems, applications, and peripherals.
Developed automation scripts to streamline recurring maintenance tasks and improve system efficiency.
Implemented basic cybersecurity protocols to safeguard systems from common threats and vulnerabilities.
